item.title: The guide to the absolute Beginner in Data Science
item.description: Do you want to become a Data Scientist? In this series I’ll cover the basics to study data science here. What you need to know before going in Data Science’s bandwagon I like to think Data Science as a programming carrer, because most of your time you’ll be either learning about your data and the problem within it or you’ll be manipulating it, building machine learning (ML) models is not time consuming, and to be fair most of the time is an “experiment and try” thing, however ML has a deep mathematical theory behind it, and if you want to be a good data scientist you’ll need to develop a fair comprehension about the field.

item.title: About Me
item.description: I’m a data scientist currently located in Brazil, São Paulo. From my set of skills I can highlight: Data Analyzing and Data Management (Python, R) Data Warehouse consulting and management (SQL, noSQL) Machine Learning model development, deployment, verifying and debugging (Python) Debugging and developing ETL jobs (Python) Experience with development environment (github and docker) Experience with Cloud Services (Amazon S3, Google Cloud, Airflow and Jenkins) Experience reading through library’s documentations Experience applying Machine Learning models to solve marketing and fraud problems Work Experience 2018 - 2019 :: Business Inteligence Internship at evino
